column4: Hi, I tried to ask in #OOo, but nobody answered. So I'll paste it in here again. I got issues with base in lucid.
Hi, I'm using OOo in ubuntu lucid 10.04. It's version 3.2. It seems that I cannot create a new database.
oo tab gives oowriter, oocalc .. but no oobase.
file>new> lacks database, so I guess it's not possible to load adresses from a ods list to print lables in oowriter?
I can load the ods from tools>options... and in the register OpenOffice.org Base I can add the ods as a new database, but it won't save that, and it doesn't appear as a database on a new label sheet
yes, you need base installed as a dependency of the mailmerge stuff (you don't need to run base, just have it installed)
openoffice.org-base-core <- I guess, that's the right package (apt-cache search lists that)
Nope, I'll try it with openoffice.org-base
you can also do tab complete when installing stuff so sudo apt-get install openoffice.org-ba<tab><tab> will list the possible completions
http://pastebin.com/Dgb7jsZT  E: Broken packages and  http://pastebin.com/vNzN2ey6
that looks annoying, did you do an apt-get update first? I don't have Lucid so I am on LibreOffice so I can't really test that
I would be a bit cautious of that
well it might well work and be awesome, you might also consider upgrading to a new overall release of Ubuntu
